goals.question: What is the distribution of package sizes in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of package sizes in the dataset and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the most common type of dependency in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of dependency types and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between package size and number of dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of package size vs. number of dependencies
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between package size and number of dependencies, which could be useful for optimizing package design.

goals.question: What is the distribution of package names in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the most common package names in the dataset and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of package versions in the flare-dependencies dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the most common package versions in the dataset and identify any patterns or trends.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    package_sizes = data['size']
    plt.hist(package_sizes, bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Package Sizes')
    plt.xlabel('Size')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of package sizes in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Count the occurrences of each dependency type
    dependency_counts = data['type'].value_counts()

    # Create a bar chart of dependency types
    ax = dependency_counts.plot(kind='bar', color='c', edgecolor='k')

    # Set the title and labels
    plt.title('What is the most common type of dependency in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Dependency Types')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')

    # Add a legend
    ax.legend(['Dependency Types'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Scatter plot of package size vs. number of dependencies
    plt.scatter(data['package_size'], data['number_of_dependencies'])
    plt.xlabel('Package Size')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Dependencies')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between package size and number of dependencies in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
from wordcloud import WordCloud

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    package_names = data['name'].tolist()
    text = ' '.join(package_names)
    wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color='white', colormap='viridis').generate(text)

    plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='bilinear')
    plt.axis('off')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of package names in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    package_versions = data['version'].value_counts()
    package_versions.plot(kind='bar', color='c', legend=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of package versions in the flare-dependencies dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Package Versions')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Package Versions'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
